info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 11 at 2:02PM CST until January 12 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Rapid Spread of Wildfire Is Possible Friday... .A strong cold front Friday morning will likely bring a surge of very dry air and strong northwesterly winds Friday. Winds will likely diminish Friday evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 4 PM CST FRIDAY FOR THE COMBINATION OF LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS, AND DRYING FUELS, FOR ALL OF THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND DEEP SOUTH TEXAS EXCEPT THE BARRIER ISLAND... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Red Flag Warning for the combination of very low humidity, strong northwest winds, and drying fuels, which is in effect from 6 AM to 4 PM CST Friday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...All of the Rio Grande Valley and Deep South Texas Except the Barrier Island. * TIMING...6 AM Friday through 4 PM Friday. * WINDS...Northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 12 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 68. * LIGHTNING...None. * IMPACTS...Rapid spread of wildfire on drying grasses and brush is possible Friday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
